name: Jeera Aloo
history: Jeera Aloo, a popular dish in Indian cuisine, is known for its simplicity and delicious flavor. 'Jeera' means cumin and 'Aloo' means potato in Hindi. This dish features potatoes sautÃ©ed with cumin and other spices, making it a flavorful yet easy-to-make side dish.
description: Jeera Aloo is a quick and easy potato dish where boiled potatoes are stir-fried with cumin seeds and a blend of aromatic spices. It's often flavored with turmeric, red chili powder, and amchur (dry mango powder), providing a savory and slightly tangy taste.

instructions.title: Heat Oil and SautÃ© Cumin
instructions.description: Heat oil in a frying pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Potatoes
instructions.description: Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and amchur. Stir in the boiled and cubed potatoes. Season with salt.

instructions.title: Cook the Potatoes
instructions.description: Cook the potatoes on medium heat until they are coated well with the spices and the edges start to turn golden.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve Jeera Aloo hot as a side dish with roti, puri, or parathas.

tips: Ensure the potatoes are boiled to just the right consistency â€“ not too soft.
Adjust the level of spices according to your taste preferences.
variations: Add other spices like garam masala or mustard seeds for different flavors.
Incorporate green peas or diced carrots for additional texture and nutrition.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on a stovetop until warm.
presentationTips: Serve in a bowl, garnished with a lemon wedge or additional fresh herbs.
Pair with a cooling side like raita or a simple salad.
